channel.title: [Offical Realse] Map Editor V.05B
channel.description:
Hello,
Well your all are leeching cunts
Story of the day: Sent xEnt it thought i can trust him he sold to Hixk hixk gave to lefty then they both said they made it what was lies as fuck blah blah blah lefty sold it to everyone but i got to say urs u got the fucked up version and if any1 nows me they will understand what i mean
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/7739/tx20081015121655tm7.png[/img]
Fixed: / and \ walls Able to hold Shift Down and move around the maps Faster building Texture support
Download: http://uppit.com/O8YHB6
Oh yea just to tell you i never sold any of this just shows your stupid who wanted to buy it
Hixk begged me to buy it off me and i still havnt seen his own one lawls.... Lefty mate seriously stop leeching proples work and learn how to program.... xEnt need to build a friendship with people who actualy trusted him....
How it was made: Programs Delphi v6 Used the clients Map color map Basicly the clients colors ^^ Used opengl to do this progject
<3 T X

item.title: [Offical Realse] Map Editor V.05B
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Peter, post:70, topic:236783”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=312559.msg2503493#msg2503493 date=1224803483]
I beg to differ. VB/C# with visual studio or sharpdevelop are much easier to use to make simple apps.
[/quote]

They’re all called Microsoft VB, Microsoft C# etc for a reason (as far as I know). Java is the “safe way to go”, it’ll work on any platform. If for any reason Microsoft fails, Java will still dominate.[/quote]Yeah, but you can use MonoDevelop on linux.[quote=“xEnt, post:69, topic:236783”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=312559.msg2503708#msg2503708 date=1224811291]

Microsoft’s visual IDE’s C#/J#/VB.net/C++ are far easier/faster/all around better in my opinion than things like netbeans/sharpdevelop/jformdesigner etc.

It would be great to have one of those IDE’s for Java and not J#. They are fast, don’t lag your computer as much as NetBeans does, have more features and are simply just great.

I’m assuming when you said making an application you meant just the designing GUI part Pets, any language can design a GUI however fast they like, but i believe what bigh51 is saying is that VB is quicker to actually write down the code. I don’t agree with this, back when i did know some vb i still wrote faster/cleaner than i did in vb. vb just gives bad habits, makes you be lazy and not very accurate.
[/quote]Actually, sharpdevelop is faster in visual studio in some cases. What I would love is for SharpDevelop to add C++. If it did that, I would switch to it instead of visual studio forever. VB does give you some bad habits, though.

Theres a reason why its called Sharp develop.[/quote]But it also has VB, as well as C#, python, boo and a few other languages.

Read full topic

item.title: [Offical Realse] Map Editor V.05B
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

bigh51:

I beg to differ. VB/C# with visual studio or sharpdevelop are much easier to use to make simple apps.

They’re all called Microsoft VB, Microsoft C# etc for a reason (as far as I know). Java is the “safe way to go”, it’ll work on any platform. If for any reason Microsoft fails, Java will still dominate.

Read full topic

I’m assuming when you said making an application you meant just the designing GUI part Pets, any language can design a GUI however fast they like, but i believe what bigh51 is saying is that VB is quicker to actually write down the code. I don’t agree with this, back when i did know some vb i still wrote faster/cleaner than i did in vb. vb just gives bad habits, makes you be lazy and not very accurate.
[/quote]Actually, sharpdevelop is faster in visual studio in some cases. What I would love is for SharpDevelop to add C++. If it did that, I would switch to it instead of visual studio forever. VB does give you some bad habits, though.[/quote]
Theres a reason why its called Sharp develop.

item.title: [Offical Realse] Map Editor V.05B
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“Ian, post:66, topic:236783”]Lol some kiddie just added me about this landscape editor and was like

code Xsnip3rX - Deskt: the key data
(01:49) Xsnip3rX - Deskt: like
(01:49) Xsnip3rX - Deskt: which key opens which door
(01:49) Xsnip3rX - Deskt: ok
(01:49) Xsnip3rX - Deskt: for exmaple
(01:49) Xsnip3rX - Deskt: example*
(01:49) Xsnip3rX - Deskt: key 421 opens melzars maze door
(01:49) Xsnip3rX - Deskt: say i wanted key 421 to open…edge bank doors
(01:49) Xsnip3rX - Deskt: where would i go to do this?
[/code]

code Xsnip3rX - Deskt: if u dunno the answer just say so
(01:50) Mark: objectaction
(01:50) Mark: go there
(01:50) Mark: x, y with object id
(01:50) Mark: lolol
[/code]

(02:02) Xsnip3rX - Deskt: good for u, u programmed something in OGL i can program better than you in delphi and java...

Shit me i loled[/quote]

Oh my. XsniparX wishes he could code. =/

Read full topic

It would be great to have one of those IDE’s for Java and not J#. They are fast, don’t lag your computer as much as NetBeans does, have more features and are simply just great.

item.title: [Offical Realse] Map Editor V.05B
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Peter, post:63, topic:236783”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=312559.msg2502853#msg2502853 date=1224789530]

[quote author=Peter link=topic=312559.msg2502407#msg2502407 date=1224737462]

[quote author=adu link=topic=312559.msg2500849#msg2500849 date=1224643797]

Oops. Sry Didn’t read. Though it was made using java. nvm then =]

Maybe i should look into delphi, sounds cool lol
[/quote]It’s not. It’s pretty much a dead language that nobody uses now. I haven’t seen a delphi program made in a while. Also, don’t look into delphi just because you like the sound of it’s name. Look into a real language like java.

java is getting boring lol…been doing it for way too long.

On topic - Tx, how come every time i load say…Edge. All it shows is gray with the buildings, but yet in your pictures that you have posted up there, it shows everything in color (like grass, brown areas)

Move onto different aspects of Java. Create something that doesn’t connect to RSC in any way. For example, I’m writing my own Java IRC client. You could write a servlet, or basically anything.

Delphi and VB are horrible. C# doesn’t appeal me much. In C/C++ you have to mess with so many pointers.
[/quote]VB is great for really basic, simple application, although it can be used to make some higher-end applications.

[im g]http://i35.tinypic.com/25i7t6r.jpg[/im g]

Lol i rember dat
[/quote]It’s funny because it’s true.

If you want a simple app, do it with Java & Netbeans. Can’t get more simple then that :/[/quote]I beg to differ. VB/C# with visual studio or sharpdevelop are much easier to use to make simple apps.

Read full topic
